Travelling

Sorry that I haven't posted recently. I'm back in China, but blogspot is still blocked by the great firewall of China, and I haven't got around to installing Tor on my new laptop yet. At the moment, I can post on here because I'm travelling and I'm staying at a hostel that has tor installed on its computers.

This week is national day holiday week, a full week off of school. I'm travelling with my buddy Liu Kai (who I travelled with last winter). We're currently at a hostel in the ancient walled city of Pingyao in Shanxi province. Later this week we'll be going to the Yungang Caves, which features a ton of buddhist sculptures and various other works of art. (Check out the results of Google Image search!).

I'll be sure to post pictures later.

About

Well, I'm back in Qinhuangdao from Hong Kong and Taiwan. My time in Hong Kong and Taiwan was enjoyable, but not very eventful. I've got more about my time in China that I plan to blog about, but recently I've focused all my computer time on finishing a project that I'll be putting on my resume for when I apply for jobs. So blogging just isn't a priority right now.

The Olympics don't officially start until tomorrow night, but some of the events have already began. I went to the USA vs. Norway women's soccer game last night. Unfortunately, we lost 2-0, but it was fun to go. I'll be going to 3 different events in Beijing before flying home in 6 days!
